results.title: The Power makers
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Lee Robinson
results.brief_description: The film depicts a working day for a dredge operator, a train driver, a foreman and a turbine attendant at the open cut brown coal mine and power station at Yallourn, Victoria. These men join with thousands of others to convert the brown coal into electricity; the technical processes involved are shown incidentally.

results.title: The Powder room
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Michael Allder and Ann Kennard
results.brief_description: The Powder room journeys through a number of ladies restrooms throughout Canada and the United States, interviewing women and capturing through their tales an often invisible part of our cultural life. Through observations of her own, director Ann Kennard felt the need to document this female ritual and in doing so manages to explore an important way in which women socialise and impart information about their personal lives. The intimacies and morals of women find their way into the bathroom and therefore find a voice and an antidote to their isolation. Subjects discussed include sexuality, orgasm, dating, sex, boyfriends, infidelity, teenage pregnancy, sexual attitudes, body image, sexual practices.

results.title: The Postman = Il Postino
results.creator_credit: Cecchi Gori Group, Tiger Cinematografica, Miramax Films, Mario Cecchi Gori, Vittorio Cecchi Gori, Gaetano Daniele and Michael Radford
results.brief_description: Mario (Massimoi Troisi), works as a postman on a small Italian island to only one customer - the poet Pablo Neruda (Phillippe Noiret). Hiding on the island to avoid political problems in his native Chile, Neruda receives bags of fan mail daily from women all over the world. Mario is a wanna-be poet and a helpless romantic who has no luck with attracting women, and sees Neruda as the solution to all his problems. Unfortunately seeking help is not easy, as Neruda is unfriendly and aloof, but eventually they become friends, and with help Mario is able to become the poet he wants to be, and win the heart of the woman he loves. Oscar nominated for Best Picture in 1995. In Italian with English subtitles

results.title: The Post
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Evershine, Australian Broadcasting Corporation, Helen Barrow and Hugh Piper
results.brief_description: This very interesting documentary follows the workings of an independent English language newspaper in Cambodia, the Phnom Penh Post, established in 1991 by its American editor-in-chief, Michael Hayes and published every fortnight to a readership of about 5000. The highly respected Post is run by 20 staff including 8 journalists who work in teams of one Khmer/one westerner chronicling some of Cambodia’s most politically turbulent moments with insight and compassion. At the time of making this film, there was political instability, economic chaos, no democratic government in place and the Post was struggling to survive when out of left-field, news was received that oppposition leaders to the military regime, Prince Ranariddh and Sam Raisy were to return. This was good news not only for Cambodia, but for the staff at the Post. Through interviews and following the Post journalists on their daily hunt for a story, we are given a close-up view of the challenges faced by an independent newspaper and the suffering and tragedy that still exists in the lives of the Cambodian people as they strive for peace and reconciliation.

results.title: The Poseidon adventure
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Irwin Allen and Ronald Neame
results.brief_description: One of the finest disaster/adventure movies of the 1970s, “The Poseidon adventure” is set on an ocean liner, capsized by a ninety-foot tidal wave one New Year’s Eve. With the boat upside down in the water, a dozen survivors make a desperate dash for the bottom of the boat - their only way out. The camaraderie of the group is tested as they face constant danger of flooding and explosions, struggling through six levels of the boat, headed for the bowels of the ship. Aside from impressive special effects, the film essentially boils down to a battle of wills between two rival leaders of the posse - a no-nonsense reverend (Gene Hackman) and a hothead detective, Mike Rogo (Ernest Borgnine). “The Poseidon adventure” was nominated for seven Academy awards, and won two, for Best Song and a Special Achievement Award for visual effects. Adapted from the novel by Paul Gallico.

results.title: The Portrait of a lady
results.creator_credit: PolyGram Film International, Propaganda Films, Monty Montgomery, Steve Golin and Jane Campion
results.brief_description: A stunning psychological drama from director Jane Campion, set against an extravagant European background of wealth and tradition. Isabel Archer (Nicole Kidman) challenges the confines of her sheltered destiny and is determined to break free and find true love. She encounters the seductive but deeply manipulative and emotionally abusive Gilbert Osmond (John Malkovich), and the shadowy Madame Merle (Barbara Hershey). Isabel is drawn into a web of betrayal and tragedy and an internal turmoil that her strength and sensitivity of character strives to awaken from. This is a sensitively crafted and ultimately uplifting film with a strong contemporary resonance.
